org.finra.jtaf.ewd.widget

Interface IElement

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IButton, ICalendar, ICheckBox, IDropDown, IEditableElement, IHyperLink, IImage, IInteractiveElement, IInteractiveTable, IRadioGroup, IReadableElement, ISelectList, ITable, ITextField
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, CheckBox, DropDown, Element, HtmlList, HyperLink, Image, Input, InteractiveElement, InteractiveHtmlList, RadioGroup, Select, Table

    public interface IElement
    This is the base interface for all widgets

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void eval(String javascript)
      Implementing this method would allow to execute a javascript on the element
      void fireEvent(String event)
      Implementing this method would allow for forcing an element to fire a specific event
      void focusOn()
      Implementing this method would allow for the element to be brought into focus
      String getAttribute(String attributeName)
      Implementing this method would allow for getting an attribute of an element
      org.openqa.selenium.By getByLocator()
      Implementing this method would allow for obtaining the XPath, ID, name, CSS Selector, class name, or tag name to the element as By-Object.
      String[] getChildNodesValuesText()
      Implementing this method would allow for getting the text of all of this element's child nodes
      String getCssValue(String propertyName)
      Implementing this method would allow for getting the CSS value given the properties name

      Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocator

        String getLocator()
        Deprecated. getLocator is no longer reliable when IElements can be created from Bys
        Implementing this method would allow for obtaining the XPath, ID, name, CSS Selector, class name, or tag name to the element
        Returns:
        the locator to the element in the form of a String.

      • getByLocator

        org.openqa.selenium.By getByLocator()
        Implementing this method would allow for obtaining the XPath, ID, name, CSS Selector, class name, or tag name to the element as By-Object.
        Returns:
        the locator to the element in the form of a By-Object.

      • isElementPresent

        boolean isElementPresent()
                  throws WidgetException
        Implementing this method would allow for checking if an element is present or not
        Returns:
        true if the element is present or false if it isn't
        Throws:
        WidgetException

      • isElementPresent

        boolean isElementPresent(long time)
                  throws WidgetException
        Implementing this method would allow for checking if an element is present or not
        Parameters:
        time - - the length of time this method will wait for this element to be present
        Returns:
        true if the element is present or false if it isn't
        Throws:
        WidgetException

      • isElementPresent

        boolean isElementPresent(boolean useJavaXpath)
                  throws WidgetException
        Implementing this method would allow for checking if an element is present or not
        Parameters:
        useJavaXpath - - if true, it attempts to find element using Java XPath API and if false it attempts to find the element using the WebDriver's API
        Returns:
        true if the element is present or false if it isn't
        Throws:
        WidgetException

                             WidgetTimeoutException

        attributeValue - - the value that the test waits for the attribute to have

        WidgetException
        WidgetTimeoutException

      • waitForAttributeEqualTo

                             String attributeValue,
                             long time)
                      throws WidgetException,
                             WidgetTimeoutException
        Implementing this method would allow for keeping the test from progressing until an element's attribute has the desired value by the specified amount of time
        Parameters:
        attributeName - - the attribute that is having it's value waited on
        attributeValue - - the value that the test waits for the attribute to have
        time - - the length of time this method will wait for the attribute to be equal to the desired value

        WidgetException
        WidgetTimeoutException
